Ten students participated in a survey about cognitive dissonance. They were asked about their views on homelessness. Then, they participated in some charity work for the unhoused people in their city. Afterwards, they took the same survey. The scores from the surveys are depicted in the table, with higher scores indicating positive views and low scores indicating negative views.

What is the mean of the post-survey group?

skill.text: 3.B: Calculate and interpret measures of central tendency, variation, and percentile rank in a given data set.
